item.title: Linux: File and directory permissions
item.description: CContinuing our series on Linux, today we’ll look at how to manage file and directory permissions.

item.title: Linux: User Management
item.description: Managing users in Linux is not as intuitive as it is in Windows, where you can do almost everything graphically and transparently.

item.title: Linux: Process Management - Part 2
item.description: In this post continuing with useful Linux management commands, we will learn how to check processes with the ‘ps’ command, send signals to processes with the ‘kill’, ‘killall’ and ‘pkill’ commands, foreground and background processes and how to change their priorities.

item.title: Linux: Process Management - Part 1
item.description: In today’s post we will talk about some useful process management commands in Linux.

item.title: Programming Principles: Programming Language
item.description: In the first post, we talked a bit about what programming is and what a programmer does http://updevblog.

item.title: Principles of programming: What is programming?
item.description: It may seem trivial, but starting with the concepts of what a certain thing does or is, helps us develop better in that area of interest.

item.title: Version managers: NVM
item.description: The nvm(node version manager), is the version manager for node. If you already work with express, angular, react, vue and other of the millions of Javascript frameworks, at some point you had to use it and as we know there are several versions of node.

item.title: Version managers: RVM
item.description: Today in our series about version managers, we’ll talk about one of the first managers that was RVM (Ruby Version Manager), which is a version manager for the ruby language, which became well known for its Ruby on Rails framework.

item.title: Mail manager: Zoho
item.description: Often you will want your own email service for your business or personal use, there are several paid and easy to implement alternatives, perhaps the best known is Gmail.

item.title: Version managers: Pyenv
item.description: Continuing our series on version managers, today we’re going to take on the Python world and talk about pyenv which is my favorite version manager for Python.

item.title: Version managers: Sdkman
item.description: Today we are going to start our first series here on the site, which will be about language version managers.

item.title: Dynamic sites vs static sites
item.description: According to https://www.internetlivestats.com/ has more than 1,847,469,200 websites on the internet in day this post was written on March 29, 2021, probably the number of this format for its impressive size, that with almost 5 billion users.
